messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Ohio Notification
messages.msgSnippet: Oops, sorry.  I was responding to what was said at the end of the post about the R-4s.  You mean you have to turn a new one in each year? would be our answer
messages.messageBody:
Oops, sorry. I was responding to what was said at the end of the post about
the R-4s. "You mean you have to turn a new one in each year?" would be our
answer if we were ever contacted about not being "legal."

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: HarmNone <harmnone@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, November 03, 2001 4:59 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Ohio Notification


> > "You mean you have to turn a new one in each year?"
>
> Yep.....and an assessment for the previous "skool" year which can be the
> composite score from a standardized test, a statement signed by a
certified
> teacher indicating that s/he has seen the individual's portfolio samples
and
> "s/he is making educational progress commensurate with sbilities" or a
third
> option agreed upon by the local superintendent and the parents. We're
> amassing quite a file of these now with four young people the oldest of
> which is now seventeen <G>.
>
> Regards,
> Lori
>

messages.subject: Ohio Notification
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yep.....and an assessment for the previous skool year  which can be the composite score from a standardized test, a statement signed by a certified
messages.messageBody:
> "You mean you have to turn a new one in each year?"

Yep.....and an assessment for the previous "skool" year which can be the
composite score from a standardized test, a statement signed by a certified
teacher indicating that s/he has seen the individual's portfolio samples and
"s/he is making educational progress commensurate with sbilities" or a third
option agreed upon by the local superintendent and the parents. We're
amassing quite a file of these now with four young people the oldest of
which is now seventeen <G>.

Regards,
Lori
